resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
assignUser opened a new pull request, #12864:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12864

   The r_witout_arrow ci should fail now (and should be removed before merging?)

assignUser commented on PR #12864:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12864#issuecomment-1097686121

   @jonkeane could you review this?
   
   I have removed the `r-without-arrow` workflow, should we introduce a build with `LIBARROW_MINIMAL=true` instead, as this is not being tested anywhere afaik?

jonkeane commented on PR #12864:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12864#issuecomment-1098257506

   This is looking good so far. We do have a test in our nightly CI for `LIBARROW_MINIMAL=TRUE` https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/4b1fc905d0a75306176dfef34d90109804358440/dev/tasks/tasks.yml#L1339-L1346 which should be sufficient (I don't think we need to test it on every PR necessarily).
   
   I'm also going to kick off a set of crossbow builds so that we can see if these changes cause any of those to fail.
